title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Jacob H. Wissler to Roswell Waldo, December 8, 1868
summary: Wissler writes on behalf of Benjamin Frazier, a disabled man in need of support. In the letter, Wissler testifies to both Frazier's need, and his deserving character.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Family, Health/Illness, American Civil War
